instances.text: SLAV_V 307-A_201 - Literature and Film in Eastern Europe (A)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Do you hate war, want peace and are willing to do the thinking that precedes the abolition of war? Then this course is for you. It maps out the present-day terrain in the life of Slavic countries, where violent conflicts, transformed by technologies, blur the traditional borderlines between war and peace. The course teaches how to think about war by exploring its artistic representations in authentic prose, poetry, film, and song in English translation. The answers to be found can determine the major course of our lives and the lives of those who come after us.

Interested in other courses within the Department of Central, Eastern and Northern European Studies? Click here.

SOWK_V 335-A_001 - Topics in Social Analysis for Social Work Practice (A)
SOWK_V 337-001 - Culture and Race in Social Work Practice

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Before registering the course, please complete Spanish Language Questionnaire to determine which course level to start: https://fhis.air.arts.ubc.ca/spanish-placement-questionnaire-tool/

This course is aligned with level B1 objectives of the CEFR and is taught in Spanish.

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/SPAN302/

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: SPAN_V 358-201 - Divergent Visions: Peninsular Lit and Culture since 1700

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Modern Spanish literature and culture, from Empire to the European Union. Includes Romanticism, Modernism, Republicanism, and Separatism.
This is one of the required courses for Minor and Major in Spanish

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
From indigenista literature to magical realism and detective fiction, discover how Latin American literature and culture have influenced and been shaped by issues such as colonialism, national identity, race, gender, migration, and political violence. We'll read a variety of genres by authors from different national backgrounds.
This is one of the required courses for Minor and Major in Spanish

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/SPAN365/ 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Room location: TBC

Hybrid-blended, distributed course delivery format, with asynchronous online learning via UBC Canvas (www.canvas.ubc.ca) as well as required, in-person sessions on the following Tuesday dates: Jan. 7, Feb. 4, and Mar. 18.

NOTE: there will be no in-person meeting on April 8th, 2025

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This class has 50 seats and a waitlist of 10 seats. If you are unable to register or be added to the waitlist, both are full. As space becomes available in the course, waitlisted students are offered a seat. The course instructor and SPPH do not maintain a separate waitlist. Monitor the registration page and check-back for a chance that a space on the waitlist has opened.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Instructor TBC. This course is delivered in-person.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Hybrid, blended learning format - involves in-person classes on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 2pm to 3:30pm, as well as asynchronous online learning via UBC Canvas (www.canvas.ubc.ca).

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
